etymology: From the root ب ع د‎ (b-ʕ-d).

text.raw_text: بَعُدَ • (baʕuda) I, non-past يَبْعُدُ‎‎ (yabʕudu) بَعِدَ • (baʕida) I, non-past يَبْعَدُ‎‎ (yabʕadu)
text.text: بَعُدَ • (baʕuda) I, non-past يَبْعُدُ‎‎ (yabʕudu) بَعِدَ • (baʕida) I, non-past يَبْعَدُ‎‎ (yabʕadu)

text.raw_text: to be distant, afar, to become distant, go away (مِنْ‎ (min) or عَنْ‎ (ʕan) from)
text.text: to be distant, afar, to become distant, go away (مِنْ‎ (min) or عَنْ‎ (ʕan) from)

words.def_text: afterAntonym: قَبْلَ‎ (qabla)

text.raw_text: after that قَبْلُ‎ (qablu)‏فَمَا يُكَذِّبُكَ بَعْدُ بِالدِّينِ‎famā yukaḏḏibuka baʕdu bi-d-dīni(please add an English translation of this quotation)
text.text: after that قَبْلُ‎ (qablu)‏فَمَا يُكَذِّبُكَ بَعْدُ بِالدِّينِ‎famā yukaḏḏibuka baʕdu bi-d-dīni(please add an English translation of this quotation)

examples.example_text: ‏فَمَا يُكَذِّبُكَ بَعْدُ بِالدِّينِ‎famā yukaḏḏibuka baʕdu bi-d-dīni

etymology: From the root ر ء س‎ (r-ʔ-s) of رَأَسَ‎ (raʔasa, “to be at the head”).
From the root س و د‎ (s-w-d).

text.raw_text: (transitive) to draft, to write or bewrite as a sketch
text.text: to draft, to write or bewrite as a sketch

text.raw_text: (ditransitive) to make master over, to make wield
text.text: to make master over, to make wield

etymology: From the root ه ن ء‎ (h-n-ʔ).

text.raw_text: to rejoice, to relish, to benefit from
text.text: to rejoice, to relish, to benefit from

etymology: See the etymology of the corresponding lemma form.

text.raw_text: second-person masculine singular active imperative of هَنَّأَ‎ (hannaʔa)
third-person masculine singular past passive of هَنَّأَ‎ (hannaʔa)

words.def_text:
physician, medical doctor
Synonym: طَبِيب‎ (ṭabīb)

etymology: From the root ح م د‎ (ḥ-m-d).

text.raw_text:
to speak well of (something or someone); to praise; to commend; to laud, to acclaim, to hail, to applaud; to eulogize, to exalt أَثْنَى‎ (ʔaṯnā), أَشَادَ‎ (ʔašāda) ذَمَّ‎ (ḏamma)‏حَمِدَهُ عَلَى صَنِيعِهِ وَسُمُوِّ خُلُقِهِ‎ḥamidahu ʕalā ṣanīʕihi wasumuwwi ḵuluqihiHe praised him for his actions and his noble character.‏لَا تَحۡسَبَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَفۡرَحُونَ بِمَاۤ أَتَوا۟ وَّيُحِبُّونَ أَن يُحۡمَدُوا۟ بِمَا لَمۡ يَفۡعَلُوا۟ فَلَا تَحۡسَبَنَّهُم بِمَفَازَةࣲ مِّنَ الْعَذَابِ ۖ وَلَهُمۡ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمࣱ‎lā taḥsabanna llaḏīna yafraḥūna bi-mā ʔataw wayuḥibbūna ʔan yuḥmadū bi-mā lam yafʕalū fa-lā taḥsabannahum bi-mafāzatin mina l-ʕaḏābi wa-lahum ʕaḏābun ʔalīmunDo not think that those who joy in what they carry out and love to be praised for what they do not do will escape torment. Theirs is [indeed] an agonizing torment.to praise or exalt (a deity)
 سَبَّحَ‎ (sabbaḥa, “to praise”), مَجَّدَ‎ (majjada, “to glorify”), عَظَّمَ‎ (ʕaẓẓama, “to exalt, to magnify”)‏حَمِدَ اللهَ وَأَثْنَى عَلَيْهِ‎ḥamida llāha waʔaṯnā ʕalayhiHe exalted and praised Allah.to praise (someone) as a sign of gratitude; to thank شَكَرَ‎ (šakara)to find (something or someone) pleasant or agreeable; to approve; to admire رَضِيَ‎ (raḍiya)‏حَمِدَ فِعْلَهُ وَمَذْهَبَهُ‎ḥamida fiʕlahu wamaḏhabahuHe approved of his deeds and beliefs.
text.text:
to speak well of (something or someone); to praise; to commend; to laud, to acclaim, to hail, to applaud; to eulogize, to exalt أَثْنَى‎ (ʔaṯnā), أَشَادَ‎ (ʔašāda) ذَمَّ‎ (ḏamma)‏حَمِدَهُ عَلَى صَنِيعِهِ وَسُمُوِّ خُلُقِهِ‎ḥamidahu ʕalā ṣanīʕihi wasumuwwi ḵuluqihiHe praised him for his actions and his noble character.‏لَا تَحۡسَبَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَفۡرَحُونَ بِمَاۤ أَتَوا۟ وَّيُحِبُّونَ أَن يُحۡمَدُوا۟ بِمَا لَمۡ يَفۡعَلُوا۟ فَلَا تَحۡسَبَنَّهُم بِمَفَازَةࣲ مِّنَ الْعَذَابِ ۖ وَلَهُمۡ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمࣱ‎lā taḥsabanna llaḏīna yafraḥūna bi-mā ʔataw wayuḥibbūna ʔan yuḥmadū bi-mā lam yafʕalū fa-lā taḥsabannahum bi-mafāzatin mina l-ʕaḏābi wa-lahum ʕaḏābun ʔalīmunDo not think that those who joy in what they carry out and love to be praised for what they do not do will escape torment. Theirs is [indeed] an agonizing torment.to praise or exalt (a deity)
 سَبَّحَ‎ (sabbaḥa, “to praise”), مَجَّدَ‎ (majjada, “to glorify”), عَظَّمَ‎ (ʕaẓẓama, “to exalt, to magnify”)‏حَمِدَ اللهَ وَأَثْنَى عَلَيْهِ‎ḥamida llāha waʔaṯnā ʕalayhiHe exalted and praised Allah.to praise (someone) as a sign of gratitude; to thank شَكَرَ‎ (šakara)to find (something or someone) pleasant or agreeable; to approve; to admire رَضِيَ‎ (raḍiya)‏حَمِدَ فِعْلَهُ وَمَذْهَبَهُ‎ḥamida fiʕlahu wamaḏhabahuHe approved of his deeds and beliefs.

examples.quotation: لَا تَحۡسَبَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَفۡرَحُونَ بِمَاۤ أَتَوا۟ وَّيُحِبُّونَ أَن يُحۡمَدُوا۟ بِمَا لَمۡ يَفۡعَلُوا۟ فَلَا تَحۡسَبَنَّهُم بِمَفَازَةࣲ مِّنَ الْعَذَابِ ۖ وَلَهُمۡ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمࣱ
examples.transliteration: lā taḥsabanna llaḏīna yafraḥūna bi-mā ʔataw wayuḥibbūna ʔan yuḥmadū bi-mā lam yafʕalū fa-lā taḥsabannahum bi-mafāzatin mina l-ʕaḏābi wa-lahum ʕaḏābun ʔalīmun
examples.translation: Do not think that those who joy in what they carry out and love to be praised for what they do not do will escape torment. Theirs is [indeed] an agonizing torment.
examples.example_text: ‏لَا تَحۡسَبَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَفۡرَحُونَ بِمَاۤ أَتَوا۟ وَّيُحِبُّونَ أَن يُحۡمَدُوا۟ بِمَا لَمۡ يَفۡعَلُوا۟ فَلَا تَحۡسَبَنَّهُم بِمَفَازَةࣲ مِّنَ الْعَذَابِ ۖ وَلَهُمۡ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمࣱ‎lā taḥsabanna llaḏīna yafraḥūna bi-mā ʔataw wayuḥibbūna ʔan yuḥmadū bi-mā lam yafʕalū fa-lā taḥsabannahum bi-mafāzatin mina l-ʕaḏābi wa-lahum ʕaḏābun ʔalīmunDo not think that those who joy in what they carry out and love to be praised for what they do not do will escape torment. Theirs is [indeed] an agonizing torment.

text.raw_text:
to praise or exalt (a deity)
 سَبَّحَ‎ (sabbaḥa, “to praise”), مَجَّدَ‎ (majjada, “to glorify”), عَظَّمَ‎ (ʕaẓẓama, “to exalt, to magnify”)‏حَمِدَ اللهَ وَأَثْنَى عَلَيْهِ‎ḥamida llāha waʔaṯnā ʕalayhiHe exalted and praised Allah.
text.text:
to praise or exalt (a deity)
 سَبَّحَ‎ (sabbaḥa, “to praise”), مَجَّدَ‎ (majjada, “to glorify”), عَظَّمَ‎ (ʕaẓẓama, “to exalt, to magnify”)‏حَمِدَ اللهَ وَأَثْنَى عَلَيْهِ‎ḥamida llāha waʔaṯnā ʕalayhiHe exalted and praised Allah.

text.raw_text: to praise (someone) as a sign of gratitude; to thank شَكَرَ‎ (šakara)
text.text: to praise (someone) as a sign of gratitude; to thank شَكَرَ‎ (šakara)

text.raw_text: to find (something or someone) pleasant or agreeable; to approve; to admire رَضِيَ‎ (raḍiya)‏حَمِدَ فِعْلَهُ وَمَذْهَبَهُ‎ḥamida fiʕlahu wamaḏhabahuHe approved of his deeds and beliefs.
text.text: to find (something or someone) pleasant or agreeable; to approve; to admire رَضِيَ‎ (raḍiya)‏حَمِدَ فِعْلَهُ وَمَذْهَبَهُ‎ḥamida fiʕlahu wamaḏhabahuHe approved of his deeds and beliefs.

to speak well of (something or someone); to praise; to commend; to laud, to acclaim, to hail, to applaud; to eulogize, to exaltSynonyms: أَثْنَى‎ (ʔaṯnā), أَشَادَ‎ (ʔašāda)Antonym: ذَمَّ‎ (ḏamma)‏حَمِدَهُ عَلَى صَنِيعِهِ وَسُمُوِّ خُلُقِهِ‎ḥamidahu ʕalā ṣanīʕihi wasumuwwi ḵuluqihiHe praised him for his actions and his noble character.‏لَا تَحۡسَبَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَفۡرَحُونَ بِمَاۤ أَتَوا۟ وَّيُحِبُّونَ أَن يُحۡمَدُوا۟ بِمَا لَمۡ يَفۡعَلُوا۟ فَلَا تَحۡسَبَنَّهُم بِمَفَازَةࣲ مِّنَ الْعَذَابِ ۖ وَلَهُمۡ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمࣱ‎lā taḥsabanna llaḏīna yafraḥūna bi-mā ʔataw wayuḥibbūna ʔan yuḥmadū bi-mā lam yafʕalū fa-lā taḥsabannahum bi-mafāzatin mina l-ʕaḏābi wa-lahum ʕaḏābun ʔalīmunDo not think that those who joy in what they carry out and love to be praised for what they do not do will escape torment. Theirs is [indeed] an agonizing torment.to praise or exalt (a deity)

examples.quotation: لَا تَحۡسَبَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَفۡرَحُونَ بِمَاۤ أَتَوا۟ وَّيُحِبُّونَ أَن يُحۡمَدُوا۟ بِمَا لَمۡ يَفۡعَلُوا۟ فَلَا تَحۡسَبَنَّهُم بِمَفَازَةࣲ مِّنَ الْعَذَابِ ۖ وَلَهُمۡ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمࣱ
examples.transliteration: lā taḥsabanna llaḏīna yafraḥūna bi-mā ʔataw wayuḥibbūna ʔan yuḥmadū bi-mā lam yafʕalū fa-lā taḥsabannahum bi-mafāzatin mina l-ʕaḏābi wa-lahum ʕaḏābun ʔalīmun
examples.translation: Do not think that those who joy in what they carry out and love to be praised for what they do not do will escape torment. Theirs is [indeed] an agonizing torment.
examples.example_text: ‏لَا تَحۡسَبَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَفۡرَحُونَ بِمَاۤ أَتَوا۟ وَّيُحِبُّونَ أَن يُحۡمَدُوا۟ بِمَا لَمۡ يَفۡعَلُوا۟ فَلَا تَحۡسَبَنَّهُم بِمَفَازَةࣲ مِّنَ الْعَذَابِ ۖ وَلَهُمۡ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمࣱ‎lā taḥsabanna llaḏīna yafraḥūna bi-mā ʔataw wayuḥibbūna ʔan yuḥmadū bi-mā lam yafʕalū fa-lā taḥsabannahum bi-mafāzatin mina l-ʕaḏābi wa-lahum ʕaḏābun ʔalīmunDo not think that those who joy in what they carry out and love to be praised for what they do not do will escape torment. Theirs is [indeed] an agonizing torment.

text.raw_text: praise, eulogy, commendation‏الْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ‎ ― al-ḥamdu li-llāhi ― praise be to God
text.text: praise, eulogy, commendation‏الْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ‎ ― al-ḥamdu li-llāhi ― praise be to God

etymology: Verbal noun of جَمُلَ‎ (jamula, “to be beautiful”), from the root ج م ل‎ (j-m-l).

text.raw_text: beauty‏وَلَكُمْ فِيهَا جَمَالٌ حِينَ تُرِيحُونَ وَحِينَ تَسْرَحُونَ‎walakum fīhā jamālun ḥīna turīḥūna waḥīna tasraḥūnaThere is in them [cattle] a beauty for you when you bring them home for rest and when you drive them forth to pasture.
text.text: beauty‏وَلَكُمْ فِيهَا جَمَالٌ حِينَ تُرِيحُونَ وَحِينَ تَسْرَحُونَ‎walakum fīhā jamālun ḥīna turīḥūna waḥīna tasraḥūnaThere is in them [cattle] a beauty for you when you bring them home for rest and when you drive them forth to pasture.

examples.transliteration: walakum fīhā jamālun ḥīna turīḥūna waḥīna tasraḥūna
examples.translation: There is in them [cattle] a beauty for you when you bring them home for rest and when you drive them forth to pasture.

text.raw_text: a male given name, equivalent to English Jamal
